commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: Implement add and list command
commitResults.messageBody:
Solve Level 2.

I use ArrayList to store the list, as it is quite adaptable to changes
I might need to make in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: Add ability to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
* Changed some words in the chatbot, so conversation flows more easily
* Created the Task class to store Task related methods

Might want to change the messages for markAsDone...

Each task type is a class which inherits from classes. These are todo,
deadline, and event; deadline has a by property which is when it is due
and event has an at property which is when the event is held.

These are created by starting the input with the keyword.

Also refactored the way the input was parsed.

Solves level-4 and A-inheritance

Solves level-5
Possible improvements:
* Can I make the error handling less wordy?
* Responses to incorrect deadline /error don't match Katheryne's regular tone
* Consider grouping UnknownCommandException under KatheryneExceptions

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: Delete tasks + add some exceptions
Tests, Errors: Automated UI testing + more exception handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Originally used BufferedReader. Switched to Scanner because I was more
comfortable with it.

Added more descriptive Katheryne exceptions and made entering indexes
more comprehensive. Added automated UI testing for A-testing

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: Save files as json & load existing task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Before there was no way to save your list, which is not very
useful as the app would need to be running all the time.

Adding the ability to save and load is useful.

The jackson library is used to prepare me for the team project.

Gives more ability to extend date functionality in the future.

Still need to clean up code and include parsing for times, or using formats other than Y-M-D ...

commitResults.messageTitle: Wip: Separate out Ui and Storage

commitResults.messageBody:
There are many different kinds of commands Katheryne can parse, which are differentiated
by a command word. The process to parse these commands are similar, with certain differences.

Separating these out into different classes, and putting all of the parsing code into it's own
class, increases the readability and the abstraction of the code. It also follows SLAP
principles.

This commit extracts out each command into it's own command under an abstract command class, and
modifies the main code to use this abstracted form. It also removes unused code blocks and further
groups methods which require communication with the user into the Ui class.

It also makes the commands case insensitive, for the user's convenience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Chore: Fix shadowjar config, add javadocs
